issue.title: C++: Support non-standard gcc version strings
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-563](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-563). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
There are some GCC versions in the wild that use `gcc-Version` vs `gcc version` in their version string. These are ones built with a different locale.

Not a blocker as these are very rare occasions and rather more builds of GCC with uncommon/wrong flags.
